ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9

about.description:
AIDA (Abstract Interfaces for Data Analysis) defines abstract interfaces
for common physics analysis objects such as histograms, ntuples, fitters,
and I/O. This package provides the C++ header files defining these interfaces.

AIDA enables physicists to use different analysis tools without learning new
interfaces or modifying code. Analysis systems adopting AIDA include JAS3,
PI, and Open Scientist.
about.summary: Abstract Interfaces for Data Analysis - C++ headers

about.description:
AIDA (Abstract Interfaces for Data Analysis) defines abstract interfaces
for common physics analysis objects such as histograms, ntuples, fitters,
and I/O. This package provides the C++ header files defining these interfaces.

AIDA enables physicists to use different analysis tools without learning new
interfaces or modifying code. Analysis systems adopting AIDA include JAS3,
PI, and Open Scientist.
about.summary: Abstract Interfaces for Data Analysis - C++ headers

name: aida
raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  name: aida
  version: "3.2.1"

package:
  name: ${{ name }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://lcgpackages.web.cern.ch/tarFiles/sources/aida-${{ version }}-src.tar.gz
  sha256: 882d351bc09e830ae2eb512a2cbf44af5a82ef8efe31fbe0d047363da8314c81

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  skip:
    - win
  script:
    - mkdir -p $PREFIX/include/AIDA
    - cp src/cpp/AIDA/*.h $PREFIX/include/AIDA/

requirements:
  run:
    - __unix
  run_exports:
    - ${{ pin_subpackage(name, upper_bound='x') }}

tests:
  - package_contents:
      include:
        - AIDA/AIDA.h
        - AIDA/IAnalysisFactory.h
        - AIDA/IHistogram1D.h

about:
  homepage: https://aida.freehep.org/
  license: LGPL-2.0-or-later
  license_file: src/java/hep/aida/IAnalysisFactory.java
  summary: Abstract Interfaces for Data Analysis - C++ headers
  description: |
    AIDA (Abstract Interfaces for Data Analysis) defines abstract interfaces
    for common physics analysis objects such as histograms, ntuples, fitters,
    and I/O. This package provides the C++ header files defining these interfaces.

    AIDA enables physicists to use different analysis tools without learning new
    interfaces or modifying code. Analysis systems adopting AIDA include JAS3,
    PI, and Open Scientist.
  documentation: https://aida.freehep.org/doc/v3.2.1/api/
  repository: https://github.com/apfeiffer1/iAIDA

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - chrisburr
